quiz.title: Unit 5: Work & Energy (Quiz 3)
quiz.subtitle: Conservation of Energy and Advanced Applications (20 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics
quiz.topic: Energy Conservation and Complex Problem Solving

questions.question: When a body falls freely, its potential energy:
questions.explanation: As height decreases, potential energy is converted into kinetic energy.

questions.question: If a machine has an efficiency of 100%, it means:
questions.explanation: 100% efficiency means all input energy is converted to useful output — no loss.

questions.question: When a constant force acts at right angles to displacement, the work done is:
questions.explanation: W = Fd cosθ; if θ = 90°, cosθ = 0, so W = 0.

questions.question: Which of these situations involves negative work?
questions.explanation: Braking opposes motion, so the work done by friction is negative.

questions.question: A 0.5 kg ball is thrown upward with 20 J of kinetic energy. Maximum height reached is:
When an object falls freely, total mechanical energy:
questions.explanation: In absence of air resistance, total mechanical energy (KE + PE) is conserved.

questions.question: The power of an engine is 2 kW. In 5 seconds, it does work of:
Which of these is not a unit of work?
questions.explanation: Watt-second per second simplifies to watt, which is a unit of power, not work.

questions.question: A weightlifter lifts 100 kg to a height of 2 m. Work done is:
If energy is transferred at a faster rate, the power output is:
questions.explanation: Power ∝ rate of energy transfer; faster transfer means higher power.

questions.question: A spring with k = 200 N/m is compressed by 0.1 m. The elastic potential energy stored is:
A 1500 kg car moving at 20 m/s brakes to a stop. The work done by the brakes is:
questions.explanation: Work = ΔKE = 0 - ½(1500)(20)² = -300,000 J (negative as it opposes motion).

questions.question: A pump with 60% efficiency delivers 30,000 J of useful work. The input work is:
questions.explanation: Efficiency = Useful output / Input → 0.6 = 30,000 / Input → Input = 50,000 J.

questions.question: A 2 kg object slides down a frictionless 5 m high incline. Its speed at the bottom is:
questions.explanation: PE top = KE bottom → mgh = ½mv² → v = √(2gh) = √(2×9.8×5) ≈ 9.9 m/s ≈ 10 m/s.

questions.question: A force F = 10x (N) acts on a particle. Work done from x=0 to x=2 m is:
questions.explanation: W = ∫F dx = ∫₀² 10x dx = [5x²]₀² = 20 J.

questions.question: A 50 W motor runs for 2 minutes. The total energy consumed is:
questions.explanation: Energy = Power × time = 50 W × 120 s = 6,000 J.

questions.question: A 0.1 kg dart is fired from a spring gun (k=500 N/m) compressed 0.05 m. Its speed is:
A 70 kg person runs up a 5 m high staircase in 4 s. Their power output is:
A 10 kg block is pulled 5 m horizontally by a 50 N force at 37°. Work done is:
A 1000 kg elevator ascends at 2 m/s. The power needed to maintain this speed is:
questions.explanation: Power = Force × velocity = mg × v = (1000×9.8) × 2 = 19,600 W.
